page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY_LHANBRYDE
page.content: The village of{Lhanbryde}is situated on the{A96},8km west of Fochabers and 5km east of Elgin in Morayshire. From Elgin Cathedral records we know that there has been a village on this site since at least the 13th century. In the 19th.century it boasted 3 mills,2 schools,a smithy,a bakery, shops,tailors,an hotel,Post Office and a Railway Station. Up until the middle of this century {housing}was confined to the main road and two side streets but Post War building,both private and local authority, mainly to the north of the A96,has increased the{population}to its present 2000. Now,although the village is larger, it has no local industry being merely a dormitory for Elgin. The railway lies to the south of the {A96}but the station has gone.
